meanings.definition: To give a wrong name to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She kept misnaming her new pet rabbit, calling it 'Fluffy' instead of 'Bunny'.
meanings.sent2: The teacher often misnames her students, mixing up their names during roll call.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor kept misnaming his co-star, causing the audience to chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The tour guide kept misnaming the historical landmarks, leading the tourists astray.
meanings.sent5: The detective's habit of misnaming suspects made it difficult to solve the case.

meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly labeling or identifying someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The misnaming of the rare flower species led to confusion among botanists.
meanings.sent2: In the museum exhibit, there was a clear misnaming of the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The misnaming of the famous painting as a replica caused quite a stir in the art world.
meanings.sent4: The misnaming of the new species of bird sparked a debate among ornithologists.
meanings.sent5: The misnaming of the award winner caused embarrassment at the ceremony.
